episode_title: 404 - The One With The Ballroom Dancing

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the gang is there eating breakfast. Chandler is cleaning out his wallet.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! New wallet, huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, it was time. The old condom ring in the leather just doesn’t say ‘cool’ anymore.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You just put an empty carton back in the fridge!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, I know, but the garbage was full.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Have you ever taken out the trash? (Hands her the garbage.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I thought you liked doing it. (Rachel starts out the door and stops.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Third door on the left.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right!

content.description: Garbage room: Mr. Treeger is unclogging the trash chute as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Hey, Mr. Treeger.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Hey.

(Rachel opens the trash chute, winces at the smell, and throws the garbage bag in. She then tries to throw the pizza box in, but since it’s so big she jams it into the opening and it prevents the door from closing. She then turns around too see Mr. Treeger watching her.)

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ummm. Oh! I’m sorry. (She grabs the box and offers him a piece.) It’s a little old but…

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: No! You’re clogging up the chute that I spent a half-hour unclogging!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry. I didn’t—I don’t come in here a lot.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Oh yeah, of course you don’t!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: ‘Cause you’re a little princess! “Daddy, buy me a pizza. Daddy, buy me a candy factory. Daddy, make the cast of Cats sing Happy Birthday to me…”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I didn’t… I never said that.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: You think you could make a mess and the big man in coveralls will come in here and clean it up, huh? Well, why don’t think of someone else for a change?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, I’m sorry. (Runs out still carrying the pizza box.)
[Cut to Monica and Rachel’s apartment as Rachel returns in tears.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: God! If you’re gonna cry about it! (She grabs the box and goes to through it out.]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Continued from earlier, Rachel is now telling everyone of her experience in the garbage room.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-whoa, Treeger made you cry?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! And he said really mean things that were only partly true.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m gonna go down there and teach that guy a lesson.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, please don’t do that. I think it’s best that we just forget about it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s easy for you to say, you weren’t almost just killed.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right that’s it, school is in session! (Exits and slams the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My God! Is this a gym card?
content.parenthetical: Picking up a card from Chandler’s wallet.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, gym member. I try to go four times a week, but I’ve missed the last 1200 times.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So why don’t you quit?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You don’t think I’ve tried? You think I like having 50 dollars taken out of my bank account every month? No, they make you go all the way down there! Then they use all of these phrases and peppiness to try and confuse you! Then they bring out Maria.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who is Maria?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh Maria. You can’t say no to her, she’s like this lycra spandex covered gym…treat.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You need me to go down there with you and hold your hand?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So you’re strong enough to face her on your own?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no, you’ll have to come.

content.description: Treeger’s apartment, Joey knocks on the door and Treeger opens it.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Tribbiani! Hold on, I’ll get the plunger.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! You hold on pal! Now you made my friend, Rachel, cry. So now, you’re gonna go up there and apologize to her, unless you want me to call the landlord.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: And tell him what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Have you heard about a little something called, Not Making Girls Cry.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Yeah. Well maybe you have heard about the Rent Stabilization Act of 1968!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I have actually not heard of that.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Yeah, well your friends are in violation of it. I’ve been a nice guy up until now, but uh, I don’t need this grief. I’m gonna call the landlord and tell him that Monica is illegally subletting here grandmother’s apartment. Your friends are outta here pal.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why don’t you tell me something I don’t know! (He storms out, and once Treeger closes the door behind him, Joey makes an ‘Oops!’ have.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier, everyone is still eating breakfast.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh please, somebody tell me I don’t have to go to work today!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, my first massage today is this incredibly gorgeous guy, and every time I see him I just want to do things to him that I’m not allowed to charge for.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So do them for free.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, it is forbidden! No-no, Mrs. Potter fires people for fooling around with clients. And it’s against my oath as a masseuse.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: They make you take an oath?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I made myself take an oath. Yeah, no fooling around with clients and umm, always be prepared. Yeah, that one’s actually from the Boy Scouts, but it just makes good sense.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why don’t you just give him to somebody else?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I can handle it. No, I’m a professional. (She starts to leave)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Pheebs, is that a new ankle bracelet?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! And you got a petticure. Your feet are all dressed up.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because that’s the only part of you he can see when he’s on the table!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re gonna do some feet flirtin’!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t what your talking about. (Laughs nervously and continues to leaqve)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Then how do you explain the toe ring?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because it’s Arabian princess day at work! Okay?! Leave me alone!
[Cut to later, Joey is returning from talking to Mr. Treeger.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! My hero! What happened?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well uh, I went down there and told him that no one treats my friends like that and that he’d better come up here and apologize. I’ll see you later. (Starts to leave)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What a minute, what did he say?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He said that he wasn’t gonna apologize because you guys are living here illegally, so instead what he’s gonna do is have you evicted—I’ll see you later.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! You got us evicted!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I told you not to go down there!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well he made Rachel cry!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel always cries!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s not true! (Starts to cry.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now Joey, you go down there and you suck up to him. I mean you suck like you’ve never sucked before!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! I’ll try! But if I can’t, you can stay with Chandler and I until you get settled.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Go!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, all right, all right. (Starts to leave, stops, and turns around) I mean I’ll have to check with him first, but I’ll think he’ll be cool with it. (Monica shoos him out.)

content.description: Chandler’s gym, He and Ross are there to cancel his membership.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa, hey! Now remember what we talked about, you gotta be strong.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes. (In a stronger voice) Yes!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: One more time, “Hey, don’t you want a washboard stomach and rock hard pecs?”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! I want a flabby gut and saggy man breasts!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good! That’s good!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (They go inside) (To the guy at the desk) I wanna quit the gym.

content.speaker: Gym Employee
content.text: You wanna quit?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I wanna quit the gym.

content.speaker: Gym Employee
content.text: You do realize that you won’t have access to our new full service Swedish spa.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I wanna quit the gym.
content.parenthetical: He turns to Ross and Ross makes a ‘Be strong’ sound.

content.speaker: Gym Employee
content.text: Okay, Dave in the membership office, handles quitters. (Both Chandler and Ross start to make their way to the membership office.) Uh, excuse me, (to Ross) are you a member?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Me? No.

content.speaker: Gym Employee
content.text: Sorry, members only.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I wanna quit the gym.
content.parenthetical: horrified at the prospect of trying to quit alone and unsure about himself

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s okay man, be strong. (Chandler goes into the office.)

content.speaker: Gym Employee
content.text: So, are you a member of any gym.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! And I’m not gonna be, so you can save you little speech.

content.speaker: Gym Employee
content.text: Okay, no problem. (To someone out of the picture) Could you come here for a second?
(This gorgeous woman in spandex walks up)

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hi, I’m Maria.
(Ross is at a loss for words.)

content.description: Heeling Hands Inc., Phoebe’s work, she is giving a massage to the guy, Rick, she likes.

content.speaker: Rick
content.text: Wow, you have really pretty feet.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: These old things.

content.speaker: Rick
content.text: Would you mind spending some time on my siadic area, it’s been killing me today.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You mean the—Okay by siadic, you mean the towel covered portion.

content.speaker: Rick
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure, yeah, no I can do that, yeah, because umm, y’know, the muscles in the siadic area can get y’know, real (lifts up the towel) nice and tight. So umm, tell me Rick, how umm, how did you injure the area.

content.speaker: Rick
content.text: Oh, a 16-hour sit-in for Greenpeace.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. (She goes to work, and her head slowly drops out of view.)

content.speaker: Rick
content.text: Ow! Did you just bite me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No!

content.description: Mr. Treeger’s apartment, Joey is there to suck up.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Please don’t kick Monica and Rachel out, this wasn’t there fault, it was mine.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: You want me to kick you guys out instead?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No you can’t do that, where would the chick and the duck live?

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: You have pets!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Noo-no-no, no, those are nicknames. I’m the chick and Chandler is the duck.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Huh, I would’ve thought it was the other way around.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on man, just-just let the girls stay, I’ll do whatever you want.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Really? You’ll do anything?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah-yeah, absolutely.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Yeah, I’ve got something you can do.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What, what is it?

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Can you be my dancing partner?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s not, prison lingo, is it?

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is telling Monica and Rachel what he has to do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: His dancing partner?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, there’s this superintendent’s dance, the Super Ball. I don’t know, and he wants to impress Marge, this lady super that he’s a crush on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, why doesn’t he practice with a girl?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, he’s too shy, he doesn’t thing he’s good enough to dance with girls yet.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, right, he almost danced me right down that…garbage chute. (Starts to cry)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, would you let it go already?! You’re fine!
(Chandler and Ross enter)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! So, did you quit?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I almost did, couldn’t leave Ross there without a spotter!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait, now so you joined the gym?
(Rachel starts to laugh.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And that’s funny, why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, umm, I was just y’know working out and umm… Oh, that’s it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’re doomed. Okay, they’re gonna take 50 bucks out of our accounts for the rest of our lives. What are we gonna do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, you could actually go to the gym.
(Chandler and Ross both laugh)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Or! Or, we could go to the bank, close our accounts and cut them off at the source.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re a genius!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aww, man, now we won’t be bank buddies!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now, there’s two reasons.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, you guys, remember that cute client I told you about? I bit him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Where?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: On the touchy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And that’s not against your oath?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I know! I-I’m sorry, but the moment I touch him, I just wanna throw out my old oath and take a new, dirty one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, next time your massaging him, you should try and distract yourself.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! Like-like when I’m doing something exciting and I don’t wanna get too excited, I just ahh, y’know try to thing of other things like ah sandwiches, and ah baseball, and ah Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you, Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no, thank you.

content.description: Treeger’s apartment, Joey knocks and Mr. Treeger opens the door.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, I’m here, let’s ahh, get this over with.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Okay ahh, well, just ahh, follow my lead. (Turns on some music)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-whoa, don’t we need to do some kinda preparation first? Like ahh, get really drunk?

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Look come on, eh, just ah, just ah, put your arms around me, eh.
(Joey does so, and they both start dancing. Treeger tries to spin Joey, but ends up throwing him into the door.)

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Ahhhh! I’m sorry!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, it’s okay, but if I’m Marge, my breasts are coming out my back.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Ahh, forget it! I’ll never be any good at this, my mom was right, I’m just a big potato with arms, and legs, and a head.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on man, you’re not a potato.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: I’m sure as hell a dancer, it’s no use Marge will never go for me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on Treeger, don’t say that. You just ahh, you just need more practice. Here, come on, let’s ahh, let’s try it again. Come on. (they start dancing again) Plus, it was, it was probably mostly my fault, anyway. I mean, y’know, I’m not really that comfortable dancing with a—(Treeger throws him) We-he!! Hey!

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Yeah!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel and Monica are sitting at the table as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey-hey, how goes the dancing? Gay yet?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah-ha-ha, you guys owe me big time. (He walks into the kitchen and does a little dance step on the way.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What was that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You just did a little dancy thing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No I didn’t.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes you did! You did like a little hop.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You are soo enjoying this.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I’m not! And it wasn’t a hop it was a pademarie.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know the words! You are so into this!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, well maybe I’m enjoying it a little bit. I mean I’m getting pretty good at it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, this is soo sweet, Joey our little twinkle-toes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey, hold on, this isn’t some kind of like girly dance. All right, it’s like a sport, it’s manly!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, then show me some manly moves.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right.
(They both get up and Monica expects Joey to take the lead, but he doesn’t, and they fumble around for a little bit.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know how to lead.

content.description: Ross and Chandler’s bank, they are there to close their accounts.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’d like to close our accounts.

content.speaker: Bank Officer
content.text: Close your accounts? Is there some kind of problem?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, we’d just like to close them.

content.speaker: Bank Officer
content.text: Okay, Ms. Lambert handles all our closures. (to a beautiful woman) Would you come over here please?

content.speaker: Ms. Lambert
content.text: Hi, I’m Karen.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I wanna quit the bank!

content.description: Healing Hands, Inc., Phoebe is giving Rick a massage.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, baseball. Rick, playing baseball. Okay, slides into second, maybe even his pants come down a little… Oh no—wait no, no! No! Okay, all right, sandwiches, sandwiches. Umm, okay, on a plate, maybe Rick’s pants come down a little. No! No! Okay, Chandler! Okay Chandler, ooh, that’s working.
(The camera zooms in on the clock on the wall and it reads a quarter after one. Time lapse. The clock now reads 3:30, and Phoebe is still giving Rick his massage.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chandler’s knees. Chandler’s… ankles. Chandler’s ankle hair. (notices the clock) Oh no. (to Rick) Okay, you’re all set.

content.speaker: Rick
content.text: Oh wow! That was amazing, was that really just an hour?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! In… really long hour world.

content.speaker: Rick
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ugh, okay, I have an enormous crush on you. But because you’re a client, I can’t ask you out, even though you give me y’know, the feeling.

content.speaker: Rick
content.text: Wow! I had no idea! But you know, I could always find another masseuse.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Rick
content.text: Yeah, really.
(They start to kiss, then Rick stops suddenly.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rick
content.text: Suddenly, I very aware that I’m naked.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, quit down. (they start to kiss again)
(Suddenly, Phoebe’s boss, Mrs. Potter, and a client, Mr. Simon, enters.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Potter
content.text: Mr. Simon’s been waiting for—(sees Phoebe and Rick) Oh my God!

content.speaker: Mr. Simon
content.text: Why wasn’t I offered that? I’d definitely pay more for that.

content.speaker: Mrs. Potter
content.text: Phoebe, we have rules here, this isn’t that kind of place.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, oh and I know, but this isn’t what it looks like, ‘cause Rick is my ahh, husband.

content.speaker: Mrs. Potter
content.text: Oh really? Well, then you’d better tell his other wife, ‘cause she called three times asking where he is.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, I will tell her.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler and Ross are telling Joey, Rachel, and Monica of their bank woes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So you didn’t leave the bank?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! And somehow, we ended up with a joint checking account.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you ever gonna use that for?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: To pay for the gym.
(Phoebe enters)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! So I had a great day, Rick and I really hit it off, and we started making out, and then my boss walked in and fired me for being a whore.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You got fired?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my Gosh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s so weird, I have never been fired from anything before!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sweety…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I just-I just started walking around not knowing what to do next, y’know? I-I started asking people on the street if they wanted massages. Then these policemen, thought I was a whore too. It’s been a really bad day, whore wise.
(There’s a knock on the door and Chandler answers it.)

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Hey Duck, is Chick here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah… Bunny-rabbit.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So you ah, ready for our last practice?

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Yeah, but y’know, I think the reason we’re not getting that spin right is because my apartment’s too small.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, you wanna use our place?

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: No, I ahh, had another idea.
[Cut to the roof, where Joey and Mr. Treeger are dancing happily to ^Night and Day^.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We did it!!

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: I know, we did it!! Hey, that was incredible, huh?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know, it was amazing! I mean, we totally nailed it, it was beautiful.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Thank you, listen, thanks a lot Tribbiani, (checks watch). Oh my God, look at the time, I gotta catch the bus to the ball.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh well, okay, good luck.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Unless you wanna practice the Foxtrot again? Or-or the Tango?

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Ahh, thanks but no. You see I-I think I’m ready to dance with girls.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Go get ‘em Treeger.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Right. (Starts to leave) Hey, ahh, you wanna come? Marge has a girlfriend.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger:
content.text: Yeah, you could dance real good with her, she’s the same size as me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I’m good.
(Treeger leaves, and Joey’s dances off.)

content.description: Lara and Jeni’s Massage, Phoebe is interviewing for a job.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: So it looks like you’ve got some great experience here. Let’s see ahh, reason for leaving last job?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, they thought I was a whore.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: Okay, we’ll give a call if anything comes up.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Great! Thank you very much.
(The interviewer watches her leave with an ‘Oh my goodness’ face.)
